law.catch_line: Requirements for assisted-living communities and long-term care facilities claiming to provide special care for persons with Alzheimer's disease or other brain disorders -- Waiver on building requirements to address specific needs.

section.section: Any assisted-living community as defined by KRS 194A.700, long-term care facility as defined in KRS 216.535, or long-term care facility constructed under KRS 216B.071 that claims to provide special care for persons with a medical diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease or other brain disorders shall maintain a written and current manual that contains the information specified in subsection (2) of this section. This manual shall be maintained in the office of the community's or facility's director and shall be made available for inspection upon request of any person. The community or facility shall make a copy of any program or service information contained in the manual for a person who requests information about programs or services, at no cost to the person making the request.
Any advertisement of the community or facility shall contain the following statement: "Written information relating to this community's or facility's services and policies is available upon request."
The community or facility shall post a statement in its entrance or lobby as follows: "Written information relating to this community's or facility's services and policies is available upon request."

text.section: An assisted-living community may request a waiver from the Cabinet for Health and Family Services regarding building requirements to address the specialized needs of individuals with Alzheimer's disease or other brain disorders.

law.history: Amended 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 135, sec. 2, effective July 12, 2012. -- Amended 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 146, sec. 1, effective June 24, 2003. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 421, sec. 1, effective July 14, 2000.
